Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen and published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Which epic poem tells the story of the Trojan War?
Questions.Explanation: The Iliad, written by Homer, narrates the events of the Trojan War.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Romeo and Juliet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the late 16th century.

Questions.Question: Which ancient Greek poet wrote 'The Odyssey'?
Questions.Explanation: Homer, an ancient Greek poet, is credited with writing the epic poem 'The Odyssey'.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee and published in 1960.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Holden Caulfield?
Questions.Explanation: Holden Caulfield is the protagonist in the novel 'The Catcher in the Rye' by J.D. Salinger.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Hamlet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Hamlet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare, believed to be written between 1599 and 1601.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the 'Harry Potter' series?
Questions.Explanation: J.K. Rowling is the author of the popular 'Harry Potter' series, first published in 1997.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of '1984'?
Questions.Explanation: '1984' was written by George Orwell and published in 1949, depicting a dystopian society.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Jay Gatsby?
Questions.Explanation: Jay Gatsby is a central character in the novel 'The Great Gatsby' by F. Scott Fitzgerald.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Macbeth'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Macbeth' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare, believed to be written in 1606.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy?
Questions.Explanation: J.R.R. Tolkien is the author of 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy, published between 1954 and 1955.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'The Canterbury Tales'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Canterbury Tales' was written by Geoffrey Chaucer in the late 14th century.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Atticus Finch?
Questions.Explanation: Atticus Finch is a central character in the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Othello'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Othello' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare, believed to be written in 1603.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote 'The Odyssey'?
Questions.Explanation: Homer, an ancient Greek poet, is credited with writing the epic poem 'The Odyssey'.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Jane Eyre' was written by Charlotte Bronte and published in 1847.

Questions.Question: Which novel features the character Captain Ahab?
Questions.Explanation: Captain Ahab is the obsessed captain in the novel 'Moby-Dick' by Herman Melville.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Romeo and Juliet' is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare in the late 16th century.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote 'The Divine Comedy'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Divine Comedy' was written by Dante Alighieri in the 14th century, depicting the journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.
